use WaveFileWriter to create WAV files. If you want to append to existing WAV files, you'll need to create your own custom WAV file writer.
Hi there, can You provide some code example of that custom WaveFileWriter? It would be very helpful for me. Thanks.

Guys, nobody will do all work for you. Just look at WaveFileWriter.cs at source code section.

Basically, your approach should be open the filestream in append mode, write the data and finally update wave header (length information).
